quotes.quote: Without standards, there can be no improvement.
Every next level of your life will demand a different you.
When you're out of quality, you're out of business.
Quality means doing it right when no one is looking.
It is quality rather than quantity that matters.
To assess the quality of thoughts of people, don't listen to their words, but watch their actions.
If you want to change your life you have to raise your standards.
The quality of a leader is reflected in the standards they set for themselves.
People who live according to the world's standard are confused, and therefore get into all kinds of trouble that leads to destruction.
We're all in the same game, just different levels. Dealing with the same hell, just different devils.
Quality has to be caused, not controlled.
Standards only move in one direction. At the beginning of the world, standards were established and they've been slipping ever since.
Fast is fine, but accuracy is everything.
We classify too much and enjoy too little.
Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
You have set standards for how you want to be treated and what you expect from yourself and for yourself.
Never apologize for having high standards. People who really want to be in your life will rise up to meet them.
The standards have sunk so low throughout our culture that who really knows.
Don't shrink your standards, link yourself with those who think and ink like you.
A superior man in dealing with the world is not for anything or against anything. He follows righteousness as the standard.
Quality in a service or product is not what you put into it. It is what the client or customer gets out of it.
Acceptance of prevailing standards often means we have no standards of our own.
There is a certain standard of grace and beauty which consists in a certain relation between our nature and the thing which pleases us.
Standards should not be forced down from above but rather set by the production workers themselves.
The standards of this new time are forcing us to put our lives in order before God.
If you don't set a baseline standard for what you'll accept in life, you'll find it's easy to slip into behaviors and attitudes or a quality of life that's far below what you deserve.
Set the standard! Stop expecting others to show you love, acceptance, commitment, & respect when you don't even show that to yourself.
Standards are always out of date. That's what makes them standards.
The standard business model for corporations is to lie, confuse and deny anything that may threaten their profitability.
Change the changeable, accept the unchangeable, and remove yourself from the unacceptable
